tit.e: Kawahara no Miya Palace (an ancient Imperial Palace where Empress Kogyoku lived in the middle of seventh century)

sen.j: 川原宮（かわらのみや）は、7世紀中期の皇極天皇が営んだ宮。
sen.e: Kawahara no Miya was a Palace in which Emperor Kogyoku lived in the middle of the seventh century.

sen.j: 一般には飛鳥川原宮と呼称される。
sen.e: It is generally called Asuka no Kawahara no Miya.

sen.j: 奈良県明日香村川原に現存する弘福寺（川原寺）の地にあったと伝えられている。
sen.e: It was reportedly located at the place of Gufuku-ji Temple (Kawahara-dera Temple) now existing in Kawahara, Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本書紀によると、655年の冬、板蓋宮が火災に遭ったため、斉明天皇は川原宮へ遷ったとある。
sen.e: Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) described that since Itabuki no Miya was destroyed by fire in winter in 655, Emperor Saimei moved into Kawahara no Miya.

sen.e: Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) describes that since Itabuki no Miya Palace was destroyed by fire in winter in 655, Empress Saimei moved into Kawahara no Miya Palace.

sen.j: その翌年（656年）には新たに岡本宮を建てて遷宮しているので、一時的な仮住まいの宮殿だったと考えられる。
sen.e: In the following year (656), she built Okamoto no Mia, to which she moved in, so Kawahara no Miya is considered to have been a temporary Palace.
In the following year (656), she built Okamoto no Miya Palace to move in, so Kawahara no Miya Palace is considered to have been her temporary Palace.

sen.j: 斉明天皇の没後、斉明天皇の子である天智天皇のときに川原宮は川原寺（かわらでら）へ改められたとされている。
sen.e: After the death of Emperor Saimei, Kawahara no Miya is deemed to have been changed to Kawara-dera Temple in the era of Emperor Tenchi, a child of Emperor Saimei.
